articles.title: UK police sentence Chinese scam mastermind after seizing nearly
articles.author: Erin Hale
articles.summary: Zhimin Qian, 47, was sentenced by the Southwark Crown Court in London on Tuesday. Qian was found guilty of money laundering and possessing illegally obtained cryptocurrency. Qian helped mastermind an investment scam in China between 2014 and 2017 that defrauded 128,000 people out of roughly £4.6bn. Qian fled China in 2017 and spent the next seven years travelling between the UK and other countries without an extradition agreement with China. Qian came to the attention of UK authorities in 2018 when she tried to buy three London properties worth 40.5 million pounds ($53.2m). Qian disappeared from the UK in 2020, but not before police seized items from a safe deposit box.
